RileyStart: ^Oh hey! Alex said you might stob by. I'm Riley. Let me guess, you're a whiskey drinker.
RileyWhiskey: ^I can just picture you curled up by a fire reading Anna Kerenina, or something. Sounds pretty cozy to me. All you need is this to enhance your vibe.

c-1: ^Oh, I'm so sorry. Complete stranger hands you a drink at a party, what was I thinking? <She reaches back and takes a sip of your drink>

c-0: ^Not me, but a friend of mine. I love being around people like this, but her experience reminds me that it gets really uncomfy for some folks.

c-2: ^My granda would read me scenes from Anna Karenina when I was in high school. I tried reading it myself at summer camp one year, but oof, 900 pages?

c-0: ^I know it's cliche, but the scene at the train station at the very end. So tragic, and so gorgeous.
^But try the drink! Tell me what you think.

c-1: ^I do it when I have to, but I'd much prefer to listen. Audiobooks, podcasts, gossip. But try the drink! Tell me what you think.

RileyDrink: ^<The drink that passes your lips blossoms with the flavors of a crisp fall day. It is way too good to be served at this kind of party>

c-0: ^Haha, not really, my granda just really loved whiskey, so he taught me to make all of his favorites. I wouldn't know where to start if I had to start with vodka or rum.
c-1: ^Tacit compliment much appreciated, but this is best enjoyed slowly. Plus, pro-tip, holding a cup at these kinds of parties gives you something to do with your hands.

RileyVodka: ^A fine choice, comrade, how else are we going to keep our balls warm on these Siberian nights? Oh wow, I'm so sorry, I don't know where that came from.

c-1: ^Ha, I wish. You know, I think it should be a rule that all college parties should have a designated bartender.
^Not at all! <talks about the joys of having someone taking care of you>

s0: ^ Riley aknowledges you briefly with a glance, but continues speaking with someone next to her.
s1: ^Riley smiles and excuses herself to refill her drink.
